description:
I love this place. It's probably a good thing that it's across town or else I'd be in this deli everyday stuffing my face with assorted deli meats and stuffed peppers. 

You can't go wrong with any sandwich in this shop- they all taste amazing!
author: Angel F.

description:
I like this place. It's an uphill battle for me to get here, like literally, I have to walk half a mile up hill but it's worth it. The staff is super friendly and helpful.

The food tastes great especially if you like Italian delis. If you don't, then I don't know why you're reading reviews for an Italian deli. My only gripe is that I am no bread expert and spotting breads from the breadbox is pretty tough for me. The only bread I can tell from sight is dutch crunch but they never seem to have it when I get there. Also, the seating is limited so I always have to grab it to go. If I'm ordering for a friend, I think it's weird I have to hold their bread. 

I haven't bought anything other than a sandwich but the selection of cheeses, meats, and wines is pretty solid.
author: Larsen R.

description:
If you're a fan of classic Italian delis then you'll definitely love this place. It's one of two spots in San Francisco where you can get a great Italian cold cut sando and pack your bag with other goodies from the store. My other favorite, Lucca on chestnut. Honestly, it's a tie for who's better in my book. I digress...

Ordering Molinari is best done via the yelp app because you never know what the lines are going to be like at this institution. This past week I grabbed a cold cut sandwich to go and spent a glorious Indian summer day eating in Washington square park. Could I get more Sf? Don't think so. 

The sandwich was packed with all kinds of great meats a little lettuce, tomato and mustard. My only complaint is the French roll is terribly difficult to eat. It's tough and by the end of the monster sandwich, your jaw is a bit tired. Get it with a different bread like foccica and you'll be stoked!
author: Benjamin F.

description: Grab a loaf of bread from the bin, take it to the counter, and order your sandwich.  This place is an SF institution and I feel like to say you've ever lived in SF, you need to have ordered at least one sandwich from Molinari's.  What can you say about this place, the bread is fresh and the meat selection is top notch.  While lots of sandwich shops have gimmicky features, this place is old school.  Although I haven't yet ordered every sandwich offered, I have to say that I've yet to be disappointed - there are not bad options.
author: Tom G.

description:
Finally I got around to visiting the Famous Molinari Delicatessen on Columbus Ave in North Beach in San Francisco. Their deli meats are sold in most grocery stores now.  Ohh the sandwiches are delicious...true great quality sliced deli meats and local fresh baked bread/rolls. Cute store setup with an old fashion turn of the century SF Italian shop look with other staples like olive oil, vinegars, cookies...

It was crazy busy on a Saturday afternoon. The tiny deli was packed with wall to wall folks. Do yourself a favor and grab a pull number right when you step in. We pulled #9 (109) and they were serving # 90.so be patient. You have to wait for your number to be called to make a purchase. That includes ordering a sandwich, ordering sliced meats, and  buying any shelf items. 

If you order a sandwich....things to know...the sandwich menu is towards the back of the shop. Muscle your way back there through the crowds of already waiting folks. Also grab, with tongs, your choice of sandwich bread from the big ole bread box. Once your number is called out, hand over your bread to the folks over the counter and tell them what sandwich you want. Gotta warm you this place gets packed, standing side by side with the masses and your bread clutched in your hand within sneezing distance from everyone. Next time I'll be prepared and bring my own baggie to safeguard my bread. 

They have only 2-3 small bistro tables out front. So plan on taking your food to go.
author: Lillian W.

description: I was impressed by the Molinari Delicatessen. I ordered the Luciano Special ad it was awesome. I think it was loaded with Parma prosciutto, sweet coppa, fresh mozzarella, sun dried tomatoes and more! This was a very large sandwich, which I share with my mom and she also liked it. I will come back for sure!
author: Elena L.

description:
I do have to add a disclaimer that I'm not the world's biggest sandwich fan, but I do love good bread when I see it. 

While the bread (I got a thin green onion one) was of decent quality, it lacked that chewiness that really sets good bread apart 3/5.  Separately, that prosciutto was quality though, super fatty, chewy, pretty salty, and all around tasty 4/5. Peppers were also fairly standard. The mozzarella they used was pretty tasty and a tiny bit chewy. The bread to ingredients ratio was solid, and they distributed the meat well in the sandwich.

I'd imagine that getting it hot and fresh at the shop, and grabbing a spot outside in the sun with a cup of coffee would make this even better. Some of my coworkers are obsessed with this place though.
author: Nicole H.

description: My favorite salami shop in Little Italy.  On every trip to San Francisco I trek out to Molanari to purchase several salami to take home.
author: Leimomi S.

description:
So amazing. You walk in and take a number than go over to the bread box and pick your own bread. You hold your bread while you wait for your number to be called. The slice the meat to order. 

I cannot begin to tell you how amazing these sandwiches are and how you should def not go if you don't have time to wait bc they take their time making your sandwich and you can taste the love!!
author: Nicole S.

description:
Love this place! I spent my 3rd year of college in Italy so every visit is a trip down memory lane for me.

My favorite hot dog shop in the east bay (Top dog in Berk) buys their calabrese sausages from here! I guess now I won't need to go to Top Dog and just go here and grill my own! We are actually bringing a pack of the calabrese dogs to Coachella next wknd! 

My job is down the street so we often order take out for lunch. They will ALWAYS mess up at least one sandwich just pray that it isn't yours!! Otherwise they would've had 5 stars!! also the health score (87/100) wasn't so appealing! 

They also sell frozen family size lasagna in the freezers if you need something for dinner really quick!
author: Jazmine S.

description:
One of the best delis I've been to. I came across this place while waiting for a table at Tony's Pizza just down the street (just had to get a sandwich to warm up before the pizza.. also, if you want the best thin crust pizza visit Tony's) and I was walking through the neighborhood and stumbled upon this beautiful deli. 

Can't remember what I ordered but I'm sure it was some sort of turkey sandwich involving some good sauce and avocado. The ingredients were very fresh and and the sandwich just tasted top notch. Dutch Crunch bread was outta this world. I'm gonna return as soon as possible
author: Sasan S.

description: They were super helpful in a pinch. I had another order get cancelled last minute and they rallied to make my sandwiches and get them delivered in time! Highly recommend.
author: C. K.

description:
Fantastic sandwiches, period. One of the great lunch spots in the city. Accordingly, it gets very crowded, but without question worth the wait. If you haven't been in before, make sure you grab a number from the ticket machine on the counter or you won't get served. Also, be sure to find the fresh bread bin after you get the ticket (back middle of the restaurant space by the cooler). It really doesn't matter what sandwich you order, all are delicious and customizable. 

It takes a little time, is pricey, but there is no doubt it's money very well spent.
author: Jeff H.

description: Ingredients tasted fresh and high quality, especially the fresh mozzarella! The French bread was a bit too hard and crunchy... even cut my mouth a little!
author: Marivin T.

description:
Grab the Luciano special after you grab.. wait scratch that you don't pick up bread with the tongs for this sandwich bc it's " special" ( in my soft voice ) and they have the bread behind the counter ...such a rookie I am ;(  

Back to my original point ... I love yelp bc it makes me order things I typically wouldn't order if I went in blind or with my tendencies/habits..

The Luciano special was tasty , filling and most importantly different from anything I've ever had. Definitely worthy of its rating.

The Luciano has prosciutto (sp?) coppa (sp? ) mozzarella ( ty auto correct) and some other tasty ingredients I would never think to slap together...

-rod aka 1st grade spelling cha-Mp-peonnnnnnnn
author: Rod M.

description:
Sweet sandwich song of my soul, you're what I turn to in times of trouble. Like any self respecting NYorker, raised by a pack of italians, transported to the other side of the world - I don't do so well if you take me too far from an Italian deli. Something about tossing and turning in my sleep muttering words my spouse doesn't understand "capicola", something, something, artichoke, MORTADELLAAAAAAAAAA!!!!(said to the tune of Stelllaaaaaa)  

Not italian sandwiches as in "italy today" but, italian sandwiches as in "italian-american". It's splitting hairs. Their hot coppa brings me home.  

Yeah it's hanging out with mustard and mayo and whatever else. But, it's still good, ok? Still good! When I don't get it in a sandwich from here, I buy it @ Falletti Foods. Worth an eating, I tell you. Worth an eating!
author: Liss T.

description: Oh yeah...the hype is real. I visited here with a friend and was told to get there before the lunch rush. We walked up Columbus and ducked inside before all of the tourists could get in. Grabbed a number and headed to the bread bin. I choose the rosemary loaf and handed it to the old man behind the counter. I went with the Molinari Special a.k.a. the Italian combo and with all the fixings less mayonnaise - that is just wrong. This thing topped out at $11 which is fair and I really didn't know what I was getting into until I sat down at one of the three tables outside and unwrapped the beast. It was piled high with cold cuts and cheese; although I have to admit I do like my meat sliced thinner. Just the right amount of oil and vinegar helped to meld all the flavors together. The bread was the perfect density and the meats were cured extremely well. The provolone added a nice nutty flavor to the sandwich. Its an experience to eat here and watch all the tourists walk by taking photos of the surround area. Be advised that there are a lot of pigeons loitering in the area.
author: John C.

description: Oh yeah baby. Italian combo delivery. Chin up people. Dreams do come true. My one critique of this place is they had no sourdough option. That's sacrilege.
author: Darin E.

description: Hubby works awfully close and will often bring us lunch... so lucky!!! Yesterday he brought the turkey pesto (chock filled with yummy roasted red peppers and mozzarella), a Molinari's special for himself, and a meatball sandwich for the little one. Fresh, delish bread and perfect ingredients... I knocked off a star because they forgot my ham and cheese and sent a second meatball sub instead. Don't get me wrong - I ate it. And it was fantastic! But I really wanted that ham! He also brought a frozen lasagna which we had for dinner the next night - it was veggie so not my favorite but flavorful and well made so that's my own issue! Overall, yum'
author: Aubrie R.

description:
I love a good sandwich but this goes beyond the sandwich. 
I asked for the molinari special but a spicy variation. So they put the hot coppa in the sandwich for me. I was just going to eat half the sandwich on our drive back to Oakland but before we finished crossing the bridge, I had already eaten the whole thing.

I just remember looking at the cross section of the sandwich with every bite. It was perfection. Every bite had an even distribution of the meats, cheese, and sandwich dressing. I couldn't keep myself from inhaling the sandwich. Now I dream about going back so I can get 2 sandwiches, one for the drive back, and one for my actual meal.

I've been told many times, "You gotta try this" and I've been skeptical but I was totally blown away. Of course it doesn't hurt when Bourdain's words back up the suggestion. :P
author: Soy Y.

description:
Arrived and trying to figure out how to order.  Young lady instructed me to pick out a loaf of bread and bring to her. Then she took my order. 

Ham and turkey was ordered with all but peppers.  So mayo mustard lettuce tomato onions and cheese. Provolone was the choice. 

Ingredients were very fresh.  

My only issue was the bread.  Extremely hard.  Had to break some off just to eat it.  Mainly the edges. Other than that just delicious.  Definitely be back and try to do a better job on the loaf choice. :)
author: Earnest S.

description:
Molinari is our go to for Italian grocery staples.

Molinari does a bang-up lunch business with sandwiches and salads galore, but we go for kitchen staples. Great selection of olive oil, various tomato products, pasta, deli meats and real Italian cheeses, excellent imported tuna in olive oil, vinegar's...To avoid the lunch crowd, go in the morning or afternoon.
author: John C.

description: I passed by this place one time and I really wanted to try it but I didn't have enough money to buy one of their sandwiches so I said to myself that I'll try this place some other time. Today I did their staff was nice I asked one of them how long they've been in business and she said for a long time. They have a lot of choices for you the choose. For you to have a sandwich you have to choose the bread of your choice. I had their meatball sandwiches and it was a  I would definitely go back
author: Jeremiah E.

description: Molinari Delicatessen is a masterpiece in the heart of San Francisco. A true Italian vibe that shines bright through their employees and store. We stopped by recently while walking by to see what the place looked like. Once inside, all the Italian meats, pastas, cheeses, wines, and deli counter offer such a welcoming place. We ended up getting some "off the menu" sandwich that was HUGE. One of the employees said he used to make it all the time when he first started working there. The sandwich was loaded with 4 different kinds of meat, fresh mozzarella, fresh focaccia bread, and an array of other delicious toppings. The sandwich was so incredible that we returned the very next day to order it again. Overall, the staff was very friendly/helpful, the food was amazing, and the atmosphere is the cherry on top. I would HIGHY recommend stopping by if you are in San Francisco.
author: Chaz D.

description: Amazing, the owner is a sweet Italian men that took the time to talk to me about pasta and tomatoes. He was awesome. We got some cheeses and wine, some San Marzano tomatoes, and dessert. You feel like you are at the Italian farmer market!
author: Kriss M.

description:
I've only had the sandwiches here, and it takes a bit of trial and error but I finally figured out how to get a delicious order here!


---- SANDWICHES ----

Luciano Special: 5 stars
The sweet coppa meat is amazing, and the mozzarella adds so much texture. If you only get one sandwich here, this is it. A bit too salty for me though, probably due to the carpet of sundried tomatoes spread on the bread.

Lucca Special: 3 stars
Would be way better if I had added mozzarella to it.

Sausage Sandwich: 3 stars
Love the sausage and juicy peppers but needs sauce or aioli. Get this on oregano bread next time and ask them to press it like the Luciano.
author: Letitia L.

description: This is a must visit for lunch with a great selection of classic sangwiches, loved it
author: Ariel D.

description: OMG, so good. Sesame bread is my favorite and the spicy coppa is out of this world. Are half and took half for the plane. We definitely don't have delis like this in San Diego, we need some!
author: Elaine P.

description:
Love this place.  When ever I am in San Francisco I go here to get raviolis  and lasagna  to bring home to my freezer.  I will say I travel with a "seal-a-meal" .  
But the sandwiches are the best.  Yes they have a limited bread choice ... but the toppings are the best.  I like the grilled focaccia special.... Top quilty prosciutto, fresh mozzarella, sun-dried tomatoes.  My hubby , what ever strikes his facny at the case.
I also buy my italian caned tomatoes and sauce and cheese... best price anywhere.
It is busy and parking can be a challenge ... but go ... you will love it.
author: India G.

description:
This place is a small deli with amazing sandwiches. My sister and I got here for lunch around 11:30 on a Wednesday and it definitely got a bit packed as people waited for their number to be called to order their sandwiches/salami etc. 
To start, you take a number at the front and for a sandwich, there's a clear bread box in the back where you pick which bread you want for your sandwich. 
What we got:

1) Renzo special: this sandwich was so so good--the mozarella was so fresh and the salame was stuffed in there. They definitely don't skimp on how much they put in this sandwich. 
2) Basil Turkey special: I'm a big fan of pesto and turkey so this sandwich was probably one of my favorites!
3) Molinari special: I ordered this for my bf and both he and I really enjoyed this sandwich. It was huge, filling, and had just the right amount of meat, lettuce, etc. to make it a well-rounded sandwich.

We'll definitely be coming back here for the sandwiches and to try their cheeses and other goods too!
author: Shannon N.

description:
This is an old school Italian deli located in North Beach/Little Italy that serves up delicious and hearty sandwiches! There's so many to choose from that it can be overwhelming but I can assure you that anything you order will be delicious as all the cuts of meats and cheeses are sliced fresh and you can see them in the wooden glass display. No mystery meats here!

When you come in, take a number. They still operated on a number system because it's THAT popular at all times of the day. Then select your bread from the display case. This part sort of grosses me out because even though there's tongs because you're essentially holding your bread with your germy fingers as you await for your number to be summoned. No big deal though, that's the cost of a dang good sammie!

I enjoy the old school-ness of this place. The refrigerated section is host to a plethora of cheeses. The rack nearby has all sorts of pasta goodies. They carry an extensive selection of imported italian goodies for your taste buds. 

All the way to the left is a frozen section home to homemade raviolis and pastas for takeout. 

While I do adore the authenticity of this place, I wish they would have a separate line for take out orders. It's a pain to have to wait in line while they arduously manicure every sandwich order while you only have ready to eat items to check out. This place is so ballin' and old school that they probably don't care and out of fairness make you wait!
author: Connie M.

description: Great service. All kind of salon services are provided. Had been to my location for hair cut, spa. Medicure and Pedicure. Equipment used are hygiene.
author: Catalina T.

description: This is a really cool Italian deli in SF. They have a wide variety of imported Italian goods including OO flour that is used for making pastas and pizzas. I think that the actual grocery store was awesome. The reason for the 3 star review though is for the sandwich that I ordered. First off, the bread was fantastic. Really good quality. The part that I was upset about was the overall flavor and the lack of toppings in the sandwich. The guy making my sandwich was a really nice guy but he literally put WAY too many sun dried tomatoes in this thing. Not kidding, I think the sun dried tomato to meat ratio was the same. The meat had good flavor but there wasn't that much meat in the sandwich. The sandwich could have definitely benefited from some spicy peppers or at least some other toppings. I would totally come back for the grocery store but I would probably try another sandwich.
author: Steven K.

description: Omg what a great deli the bread is super fresh and meats cut in front of you, piled high. Worth the $12
author: Murrough M.

description:
If I could rate this place a 6 I would. I also can't say anything about this place that hasn't been said countless times, so I'll keep this brief. 

This place is a North Beach institution and home of the best (and my favorite, obviously) sandwich in the world, the Renzo. I always get it with hot coppa and pepperoncinis for a little extra tang. This sandwich also comes with fresh mozzarella and their world famous salame. 

If you're visiting SF and want a true Italian deli experience you need to come here!
author: Kat L.

description: Tip 1: Take a ticket if it's busy. We arrived @ 8.15am. There were just 2 other customers there. Besides all the sausage, salami, prosciutto, there's an awesome selection of cheese, olives, gnocchi, and Italian wine. The refrigerator holds ravioli dinners to go!!  Get your salami here! Yum!
author: Lorene P.

description: Really good but gets busy I waited a long time on a sunday to try i might not come back because im impatient lol. The guys behind the counter are great and friendly tho.
author: Christina A.

description: We happened to come here after a run and we were lucky enough to get the last dutch crunch roll in the bin. It was this tiny little thing that was kinda squished but best believe I brought that roll up to the counter to get my sandwich made. I opted for a chicken parm and also grabbed a stick of copa and salami - which I made Gemma carry in her purse. Being in Hawaii, we can get Molinari at Foodland but sometimes, getting it from the source tastes a little better. Our sandwich comes out and it's cheesy, crunchy goodness. There's never any seating out here so we ended up sitting right outside on the curb but it was one of those perfect SF days. I'll always love coming to North Beach and Molinari is one of those places that you have to stop and visit.
author: Cameron B.

description:
I stopped at Molinari's on my way out of SF. Grabbed some sandwiches for the road and called it a day. The first few seconds inside of the deli is the best part of your experience here. It all feels authentic. No baloney (no pun, for once), they have preserved it the way it has probably always been. 

They make you grab your own bread from a container across from the meats. You are screwed if you go towards the end of the day as what they have is what they have. If you are a germophobe, you might think twice about what you are doing but you will end up doing it anyways. The lady that prepared my sandwiches went gloveless but again when in Rome, pun intended this time. 

The deli offers more than just sandwiches, italian products for the Delpino's of the world, shout out to Vinny.

My sandwich reached good status. Their cuts were average and the ingredients semi-fresh. Maybe it was the end of the day effect, or maybe it was not. Regardless, Molinari's has to make it onto your stops one way or another. The vibe inside is enough to come and experience part of what makes diversity so beautiful. The sandwich being any good is just extra.
author: Javier J.

description:
WORTHY OF A 5 . Seriously GREAT deli place! 
1. Friendly workers and knowledgeable of their products
2. Great selection of cheese (: 
3. Great prices 
4. Delicious sandwiches MY ULTIMATE favorite is the "side walk tour" sandwich 
Consist of: fresh mozzarella, dried sun-tomatoes, pesto, salami and red peppers WOW!! That's all I have to say WOW. 

We took a tour a couple of yrs. ago and this shop happen to be part of it and this is how we know about it 

Wish they ship their products to Rancho Cucamonga, Ca (;
author: Eliza B.

description:
Came here on a Friday for lunch. 

Food: Being a vegetarian, sometimes sandwich shops can be difficult, but here they have a great veggie option. I got the veggie special and it had sun dried tomatoes, lettuce, mozzarella, and other tasty stuff inside. This sandwich was full of flavor and very filling. My boyfriend got a meat sandwich, tried mine and said he was getting it next time.

Service: You pick a number and get served in order. Sandwiches made on the spot.

Ambiance: Love the feel here. Really feels like a great Italian place. About 3 tables outside and it got busy quick. 

For sure coming back.
author: Hayley D.

description: It's been a long time since we've been here, over 16 years. The prices have gone up a bit, but so has everything! The sandwiches are just as good as I remembered. lots of fresh deli meat, great bread and what I really like in my sandwich are roasted red peppers. So good! they did not disappoint. If I lived in the neighborhood I'd be there a lot.
author: Vince L.

description:
We stumbled in here looking for sandwiches to bring with us to a short hike at Land's End. The plan was to picnic somewhere along the trail, maybe by a beach. Wish we could say the sandwiches made it that far...

I hadn't really looked up Molinari's before we entered, so we were the worst sort of new customers (tourists at that) that came in. Thankfully, we came in very early in the morning and did not have to suffer the frustration of not being served for not getting a number (as I read now). We did get laughed at after we were told to choose our bread (and I grabbed a full baguette). My bad! 

We ordered the Renzo special, the North Beach, and a bag of potato chips. We hadn't really eaten breakfast yet, so we thought we could split the Renzo and get away with the North Beach for the picnic idea... but NOPE. These are some impressive sandwiches... meaty, flavorful, fresh and delicious... (I'm getting hungry just thinking about them now)! SO GOOD, were they of course, that we couldn't just split one. So much for that picnic! 

Definitely worth a trip here if in you're in North Beach. Just learn from us and be realistic about how far you'll get with these sandwiches before you devour them (hint: not far).
author: Amy B.

description:
Went here for first time. Wanted ravioli for later and a sandwich for lunch. They really looked good. While I was waiting to be called to order I saw three customers pick rolls from a bin in the customer to give to the server behind the counter. Apparently that's how the customers choose their bread here. Two simply used their hands picking through the rolls. One used the provided tongs, held the roll for a bit, then put it back and chose another one.  I passed on the sandwich at that point. Everything else about the store was nice. Just see no point in letting customers man handle food that other people will eat. Not sanitary. 

Knocked it down a star. The ravioli was below average at best
author: Michael S.

description: Great local spot for fresh, authentic Italian meats and cheeses. I had the Renzo Special on the green onion focaccia bread and it was bomb! The fresh mozzarella, Coppa sausage, and sweet peppers were just . The staff were super friendly, be sure to take a number when you walk in! I'll be back on my next trip for sure.
author: Beth M.

description:
Italian combo comes with your choice of bread loaded with an assortment of cured deli meats, plus mayo, mustard, lettuce, tomato, onion and pepperoncini.

I picked out a multi-seed roll from the bin and handed it to the guy behind the counter.  I skipped the head cheese and opted to dress with oil and vinegar.

Traditionally, hard bread was softeded with oil for sandwiches made by wives for their husbands' lunches.

This bread is a soft focaccia, so the oil and vinegar pretty much soaked the bottom layer.  Still tasted good, tho!
author: Sondra H.

description:
love this place, great sandwiches.
 I have walked in and ordered online through yelp.
My favs:
North Beach Special:prosciutto, provolone, sun dried tomatoes, with sweet bell peppers.  Delis, one of my go to's
Renzo Special: prosciutto, coppa "hot or mild" fresh mozzarella, with sun dried tomatoes. love their sun dried tomatoes. so yummy
Luciano Special
parma prosciutto, sweet coppa, fresh mozzarella, sun dried tomatoes, onions with lettuce, on grilled focaccia bread
Grilled Eggplant: marinara sauce, fresh mozzarella, with imported sun dried tomatoes. Not much into sandwiches without meat but this is Delicious!
 The salames are great, and you can them whole or cut to your preference.
author: Raquel O.

description: So love traditional Italian deli's, really felt some kind of way when I was asked about the toasting of a sandwich. He asked if I need the sandwich toasted before or after, I would of rolled with having the bread toasted to gooey crunchy goodness. When, the deli guy asked the question of toasted before or after, I really had to think about it. I really dont want my sandwich heated up until the meat taste different. The meat and the deli guys reason for the meat being toasted was quit apparent. The meat tasted funny. Like it absorbed all the flavors in the cold case (other meats and foods in the cold case).  The deli guy then pointed to the condiments,  I told him I wanted everything.  Nit a mind reader,  but the regular would be mayo, mustard.  I also told him include the pepperoncinis before we got to the spead condiments. He wraps the sandwich up and asks for payment. Damn it my card really fidnt go through, so I passed him my other card. Signed the receipt and headed back to work. I was so hungry. I opened the sandwich and found that the  sandwich lacked mayo and mustard. The sandwich was 11.50, the deli guy charged me 10.50, which after eye balling my sandwich closely saw the charge was just. Damn!
author: La-Rae A.

description: Our first prosciutto sandwich .. OMG!!! Definitely a must-taste!!! Almost orders some absolutely delicious olives, mushrooms & some type of marinated legume that was to die for!! That legume tasted like a regular refried bean, only was a giant whole bean & dressed up in Italian seasonings & marinates.. words cannot describe!!
author: Melony J.

description: I was just sitting on one of their outside comfy chairs after dropping off a UPS pkg at Cole's when I saw a place to relax.  I was going to depart for a Starbucks when my tummy rumbled and I decided to explore the deli where I sat: Molinari's.  The store is old mom & pop and the sandwich counter guy is a sweet smiling guy.  Most of their sandwiches are pricey at $12 but I thought to splurge and got a Luciano sandwich special(Parma prosciutto, sweet coppa, fresh mozzarella, sun-dried tomatoes, onions with lettuce on grilled focaccia bread). I chose rosemary bread.  The meat was sliced fresh there in front of me.  Service was slow because the shop is small and it's just a mom & pop, but I felt for $14, it was definitely worth it!!   They accept CC.  When I bit into one of the two cuts of the LARGE sandwich, I felt that EXPLOSION of taste from all of the sundried tomatoes and the meat.  The melted cheese inside the fried panini tasted so good, everything fresh.  You can't go wrong buying your sandwich from Molinari's for lunch in the NORTH BEACH area.
author: Frugal C.

description:
This is like coming home. Pull my number from the number machine (more about that later) get the roll I want and decide on a sandwich.  Walking into Molinaris Delicatessen is like the past 20 years it's been since I lived in this neighborhood haven't passed at all.
If it's your first time and you want to be waited on for ANY reason, get a number. It will be the difference between a pleasant experience and possibly kicking yourself for having to wait behind the half dozen or so people that came in behind you but did get a number. A lot of people aren't prepared to wait for excellent service and bail, so the number you're holding and the order you'll be waited on aren't always the same. 
They have a huge selection of food and wine so plan to look at the walls because there's a lot to see in such a small space.
author: Brian M.

description: My husband loves the place. Service was wonderful. Full filled my husbands additional requests. We called it "Aldo's Special". Take a look for yourself.
author: Migdarelis C.

description: Authentic Italian deli foods located in the heart of  historic Italian neighborhood North Beach. Super cute inside with the classic old fashion way to dispay their food, we loved it. It seemed  to be on a 50' movie set! The sandwiches we got were both fresh and delicious. Definitely a must to try when you are in the area.
author: Michelle C.

description:
Overall: Great little shop on the corner of Columbus for sandwiches.  I always walk by the place and decided to come get a couple to try.  

Note for first timers: get a number and wait to be called. 

South Beach Special: You pick your bread inside this bin, each piece were all really big, but all were really hard and I wish I had the option to opt for a different kind of bread. The sandwich was really good and flavorful.  You don't feel ripped off when they slap on a whole lot of meat on your bread.  

Grilled Focaccia Special:  I really liked this one because the bread was softer and it was warm.  It tasted different than the South Beach (and incase you're wondering, I had few bites from each sandwich.  I didn't finish both sandwiches, but I was kind enough to share my sandwiches with 3 others to share). =)

I'll be back again for a different kind of sandwich or maybe even some cold dishes.  

There could be a wait time, so be patient.  They also take plastic!
author: Stephanie Y.

description: Always a pleasure eating here. I just don't like the way the bread is stored and chosen. I love getting sandwiches here and going to Golden Gate Park for a picnic.
author: Debra R.

description: EVERY neighborhood should have a deli like this.  It's full of specialty meats, cheeses, wines and some excellent sandwiches.  This is a go to place for an amazing Charcuterie platter.   They have a great selection of Salami - hard to find and authentic.  This place is a neighborhood favorite.
author: Laura G.

description: Absolutely delicious sandwiches. I couldn't decide what I wanted so the person helping me let me design my own. So glad I came here.
author: Amanda A.

description:
One of the not so hidden gems in North Beach. The first time I came here was on the recommendation of my coworker. 

Service: Great local deli shop with friendly staff. I really enjoy the fact that I can come in and choose my dutch crunch roll. During the lunch rush the line does get long and service can take up to 30 mins before you even order. 

What to get: I'm a big fan of always trying the house special. The Molinari Special gives you a great mix of all their freshly cut meats. I pair mine with pesto and provolone or fresh mozz on dutch crunch. 

Overall: A very filling sandwich that can last me two meals! The bread holds up well with all the sauces you put on it as well. Tip - grab some chips to go with your sandwich!

I'll definitely be coming back when I need a sandwich fix even if it's a 15-20 min walk from my office.
author: Keizzel C.

description:
What can I say about this place that has not already been said? A San Francisco staple! I cannot leave SF without getting a sandwich from this place. 

The lines are long but well worth the wait!
author: Kendal W.

description: Really more of an Italian place then a deli (thru Sunny even sell bagels). But the meats are good. So we're the cheese. They sell authentic tiramisu biscuits.
author: Evan Z.

description:
I have been craving prosciutto lately and I was so glad my friend recommended us to go to this place for lunch. I came on a weekday right around noon. The entire process from my wait to receiving my sandwich was about 0 minutes which was not bad at all during lunchtime.

Once you go in, you grab a ticket number, grab a piece of bread from the bread bin, and hand your bread to the worker as they call your number.

I thought it was a little unusual that we get to pick our own bread from the bin to hand it to the person taking your order. You dont know if other people touched all the bread and how many germs there could be!

I decided to order the Prosciutto Di Parma which is imported from Italy! I got the sandwhich with everything including basil spread and provolone cheese. It comes with so much meat, so half the sandwich already made me super full! The meat is delicious!! 

I will definitely come back again. This is a great place to go to for deli sandwiches. They have seating outside as well and if you want to have a nice picnic at the park, the park is one or two blocks away so grab a bottle of wine with you too!
author: Allie Y.

description: So Anthony Bourdain recommends the molinari special. I usually go by his suggestions but this time it fell short. I must say, cold cuts are my least favorite things. The molinari special was pretty ordinary at best. Definitely wasn't a blow your mind away sandwich. The shop was cute though, they had a huge variety of Italian imported goods. Should've gone with a prosciutto sandwich instead.
author: Virginia Y.

description: 9 slices of prosciutto di parma with veggies & garlic-basil sauce on a giant, but ever so soft rosemary roll.... No detailed review needed, I will be back to get this again, and again, and again.
author: Alexander Z.

description: Best (maybe one of the last) Italian Deli Sandwiches in San Francisco!
author: Jon W.

description:
I finally took time to try their sandwiches, and the Luciano is orgasmic. It's a burst of flavor in your mouth that leaves you speechless and quite surprised that a sandwich can taste so delicious. Lines can get quite busy. Plan ahead, get their sandwiches with a bottle of wine and head over to a nearby park for a picnic with someone special.

Previous review (four stars); The meat, cheese and olives are amazing, and the pate is absolutely delicious. Might be good to research a bit beforehand and decide what to order beforehand as they aren't the most patient and can get a bit irritated especially at peak times.
author: Kimberly H.

description: Fresh deli meats and large sandwiches. Can get a little expensive for sandwiches, but quality ain't cheap. Only a few seats outside. We ended up eating on the steps of a church across the street.
author: Jon M.

description: Delicious! Though the picture for pickup was kind of misleading. Was expecting the basil spread but apparently you have to add it
author: Jenny L.

description: Currently on a food tour! What a fantastic place for a sandwich! The audited tomatoes, the variety of cheese and the signature salami is just a mouth full of bliss! There's no parking available and there's no WiFi. Seating is very limited to s couple of seats outside so it makes it feel like grab and go place. The cashiers are very friendly and attentive. I would definitely recommend this spot if you are in the area. Come by and grab a mouthful of goodness type of sandwich! It's also one of the last type of Italian deli in the city so definitely visit!
author: Daw M.

description:
Molinari is the perfect place to stock up on some quality Italian food.

The staff here take immense pride in their products. From the moment I walked into this well curated store - the Molinari staff were quick to assist me with finding exactly what I needed.

I picked up some great spaghetti, some homemade bolognese sauce, some fresh pesto, and some finely grated parmesan.  

As the staff helped me - they chatted with some jovial regulars that popped in. Molinari has a true neighborhood vibe, and it's clear that the staff enjoy seeing familiar faces in their darling store.

Though the sauces and pasta at Molinari are solid, Molinari is probably best known for their fantastic sandwiches, decked out with excellent meat and toppings.

If you're in the hood and craving some take-away Italian food and sandwich(es) - go to Molinari.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
If you are in North Beach, go to Molinari for lunch. Their sandwiches are delicious and the best you can find. If you have the desire, take them to Washington Square Park and have a picnic, otherwise just eat them outside at their tables. 

I recommend the Luciano Special, or any sandwich on their focaccia. It's a little confusing when you first get there, but you take a number. Don't miss the cooler in the far back with some fun, fizzy drinks. 

We received a sausage from Molinari for hosting a christmas party, and it was delicious, not to mention huge. Lasted for weeks!
author: Lauren A.

description:
Delightfully traditional and bursting with old school old , world deli smells and flavors ! A great visit , a real deli and a enjoyably experience ...San Francisco  landmark sure not to disappoint ! 

And the Salami --- its perfection....
author: Kt K.

description: Proper deli....everything you may want from an Italian deli...prices are a bit on the high side, service can be slow (no fault to the staff but the crowd)....get your cold cuts sliced here, grab a bottle of Italian Olive Salad, a loaf of bread and you are set.....enjoy this North Beach gem....
author: Eddie J.

description: North Beach is the Italian cuisine capital on the West Coast. It has a concentration of great eateries serving some of the best to be had in Italian food. Molinari has the wonderful old fashioned Italian deli feel-because its old! If you walk in the time could just as well be 1970 in terms of the very great service you get and the attractive way the food is on display. Of course the sandwiches are tasty, I had a basic Turkey , Ham sandwich on dutch roll, and there are many more to choose from .
author: Jimmy L.

description: best Italian ingredients, their cured sausages and cheese selection is superior to anything I've tasted around. My italian chef uncle exclusively gets me to hand deliver him ingredient s from this place only, all the way down to Paso Robles.  But if you need something, don't go during the lunch hour rush as this place is backed up out the door for their sandwiches during the lunch hour rush because they're that delicious
author: Taras B.

description:
If you're an Italian, a New Yorker or from anywhere in the NE do not waste your time on a sandwiche (sic) here. 
They have a few imports nothing to brag about. 
Some wine, meats and cheese. No hot Sopressata even though they advertise a Sopressata sandwich. Priced unbelievably high - Italian combo consisted of one type of meat, and one type of cheese. All on a very average six inch piece of bread for $13.00. The stupid tourists waited in lines to try this place, they don't know any better. 
In North Jersey you can get a sandwich four times as big and three times as good for the same price. 
What a disappointment, the non-Italian, non-American, non-English speaking worker behind the counter even asked me if I wanted mayo and mustard on my "Italian Combo" sandwich - what am I ordering a hoagie in the south, no I'm in an Italian deli, in North Beach - I expected more. Very disappointing, 27 years ago this place was much different, there were Italians behind the counter who knew what they were doing. The workers wore no gloves the entire time, btw I saw the pics for this place and their sandwiches looked nothing like mine. You wanna good sandwich - see my reviews.
author: Gino L.

description: Best sandwiches in San Francisco, quick and easy to order. You do have to find parking but it is WORTH IT! I will be stopping here every time I'm in town!
author: fabian c.

description:
Best salami in the world 5 stars. The average rating was in their deli lunch service. The sandwiches are 4 stars. Why the low rating?  To order a sandwich you will need to get a bread from their bread box. There are no tongs or gloves to grab the bread only your bare hand. Very unsanitary. Another point, once you give them the bread and select meats they use their bare hands (no gloves) to pack your sandwich with delicious meats. They also handle cash and credit card charges without washing their hands to prepare the sandwich for the next customer. 

I would never order another sandwich from them again. 

As for their salamis - 5 stars. Great taste and not too much fat. Try their salami sold at the shop or at certain Costco warehouse stores.
author: Geoff P.

description: I think the sandwiches here are very good. You choose your bread with the tongs provided and place your order at the deli counter. They have great vegetarian choices with fresh mozzarella, sweet roasted red pepper and sun dried tomato. You can get the sandwiches cold or hot. This is also a market which has a nice selection of fresh and fresh-frozen pasta and sauces. I also like that they carry Rummo as well as other brands of fried pasta. The only dried lasagne noodles they have are barilla no-cook but those are very good. They have Calabrian chili oil and other oils, a nice cheese selection and imported canned tomato products as well as various other Italian food products. They have 4 tables outside to eat your sandwich if you can grab one
author: Piper W.

description: A San Francisco classic! You go, hand the guy some bread, and pick a sandwich. The chicken parm is great, as is every other sandwich I've had from this place. I always leave thinking "damn, that guy made the shit out of my sandwich! Fuck yeah." A great experience overall. I'd go back more frequently if it were closer to the office
author: Jonathan Y.

description:
Italian deli in North Beach, always a wait and always worth it. Grab your number first thing and then grab a drink from the fridge in the back and then a roll from the bin if you don't want their signature focacia. Many of the canned and jarred goods are a great find for Italian home cooking and pic nics by the bay. 

My choice of sandwich is the Luciano Special on the focacia,  prosciutto, Copa, fresh mozzarella, sun dried tomatoes, lettuce & onions all panini grilled to perfection. Really, every bite is something to be savored.
author: Lindsay B.

description: Loved Molinari in North Beach.  The business has been around since 1896...so they must be doing it right.   I had the Italian Combo sandwich...which was excellent.  We also tried some pasta...also great.   Great food and great service at a reasonable (by SF standards) price...what could be better.
author: Andy P.

description:
Excellent and delicious food! I ordered a salami sandwich that came with mozzarella, red peppers, and pesto. The entire sandwich worked in such harmony that I was amazed at how wonderful a simple sandwich could taste.

They slice the meat in front of you directly on the sandwich. It's completely hypnotizing and mouth watering. They're a friendly bunch who work well together. The entire shop is filled with an assortment of cheese, deli meat and sausages. I can imagine a person being extremely satisfied if they came here looking to build a charcuterie board.

Definitely recommend a trip. It's almost an icon in little Italy so it definitely gets crowded and a bit confusing. That's the only reason it's a 4 star. Great food otherwise.
author: Angelina H.

description: Best authentic Italian deli in SF. Period!  Go for the hand made sandwiches but get the aged meats as well. Oh and the olive oils....
author: Jean B.

description: Fantastic selection and friendly service.  Bread needs more work but overall great place to visit in north beach.
author: Patrick C.

description:
When you have good quality meats and bread, it is hard to go wrong with a sandwich and this place will not disappoint you.  I ordered a custom sandwich with salami, mortadella and provolone and it was really good.  Plus if you like Italian candies this is a good place to find them.

First timers tip: When you first enter the store, grab a number and go pick up the bread that you want them to use to make your sandwich--and wait for your number to be called.  An unusual system but it works for them.
author: Bob F.

description:
An Italian deli as authentic as they come in San Francisco's North Beach, I was very eager to finally get a chance to try this place after months of eyeing it on Yelp.  

Ambiance:  This is your true Italian deli in every possible sense.  The minute you walk in you are immediately greeted by shelves of all types of grocery items like dried mushrooms, olives, pickled peppers and more.  On the right you have a long counter of cured meats, cheeses and other house-made items that you can order.  Towards the back I noticed some drinks including wine bottles making this place the perfect stop before a weekend picnic at the park a few blocks away.  When I stopped by, Molinari's was packed with people bustling in and out which only added to the fast paced ambiance of a great Italian deli.  You can tell that you're in for a treat the minute you walk in. 

Food: Ordering at Molinari's is interesting because you basically grab a number like in a typical deli but you also get to pick your own bread from a bin in the middle of the deli and hand it over to be used when ordering your sandwich.  I ordered the Molinari special(combo of their cold cut meats) with mozarella cheese, lettuce, tomatoes and mustard.  The sandwich is packed with meat, cheese, veggies and totally hit the spot for me as I was starving walking in.  The only way things could have been better was if I was outside in the park enjoying the sandwich with some wine or beer.  I really wanted to try their other menu items or cured meats just by themselves but I was so stuffed from my sandwich.  

Service: Workers here are all very friendly and can help you out with any questions you have during the ordering process.  They get your food made and handed to you in a timely manner with no problems.  

Overall Experience: Great Italian deli that I will be back for very soon as the weather starts warming up again in San Francisco.
author: Nathan N.

description:
OK 
If you are getting a sandwich
1 = walk in grab a # ticket on the right 
2= walk half way to the back before the drink refrigerator 
3= look to the left open the little see through bread bin grab the tongs  and pick out a bread for your sandwich 

(weird thing I had to use tongs but the guy I handed the bread to used only bare hands)

By the looks at some of the sandwiches in the photos I would suggest getting the smallest choice of bread in the bin maybe then it will look like a fuller sandwich compared to the one I posted
Maybe there is a secret menu like the one at IN and OUT burger has, or a password for the thicker looking sandwich 
4= wait for your number to be called 
tip = if you plan to eat there on Saturday make sure you get there before 5 = we showed up at 5 and they were putting the table and chairs away for the night THIS SUCKED cause we were from out of town and had to take our food back to the tour bus thing which was not in the plan and not close to this place = we were using the hop on ride thing and they pick up at the top of the hour which was a hour away
I guess we could have sat on the ground out front of the building and ate 

Also I guess I am used to a different kind of sandwich when I was biting into the the bread  it made me think what it would be like trying to tear a piece of a leather belt off using my teeth, i think they buy from the same vendor as swan oyster depot
Place was super cool looking inside 
I think Phil M and I went to different places or maybe he has one of prescriptions for that marijawana stuff that makes everything better in life
author: Eric B.

description: Order your sandwiches ahead of time or else you are going to have to wait! This place can get pretty busy. The food was pretty delicious and the menu is really varied so it can be hard to figure out what you want at first. It's somewhat expensive for a deli sandwich too. Overall, I really liked my sandwich and I tried my bf's sandwich so so far, it's great in my book. Now, if only they could cut the cost or the wait, but what do you do in SF?
author: Jenn T.

description:
Ok ladies and gents. Pull up a chair and let's get serious here. 

As you journey through life you occasionally come across culinary places that touch the center of your soul. Yes, it's getting deep in here so hold your nose and jump. This place is AWESOME !!!
One of the best sandwiches I've ever had in my life. The staff is incredibly friendly and make sure your getting the best sandwich possible. 

They use only the freshest of breads. Incredible salamis and cheeses. Every time I come to SFO, I come here. Grab a sandwich to go before you go on your sightseeing adventures. Your family will thank you. Your taste buds will thank you.

When you walk in it's like an old world Italian deli. Products from the old country line the wall. Imported oils and pastas. Hanging from the rafters is long links of salami. The deli case is packed with all sorts of cheeses and meats. Heck, even the floor is wood. 

You walk on over and open the bread bin. Pull out a fresh roll. Walk it on over and point to all the goodies you would like on it. I would suggest going with the fresh mozzarella ball which they cut up and put on your sandwich. Why, because it makes the sandwich melt in your mouth. Also, throw in a pepperoni stick so you can have something to munch on later. Trust me, you will thank me later.
author: Phil M.

description:
Mollinari is a true delicatessen filled with quality meats and cheeses. All their sandwiches are priced pretty well ($9-12) and you get a wide selection of choices. 

I got the Italian sausage and that was quite good, but my friend got the Renzo which is filled with prosciutto and that was great too. They definitely stuff the sandwiches well so it's worth your buck. One thing to note is if you are picky about the extra toppings, make sure to specify while ordering even if it's not listed out on the menu! 

Hope to be back to try out some other ones soon!
author: Lucy G.

description:
Man, I was not expecting the enormous amount of meat that they pack the sandwiches with! 
For the first timers (like me), you grab your choice of bread from the box, located directly against the wall. I ordered the North Beach Special (11.25$), this had prosciutto, sun dried tomatoes, provolone cheese, and bell peppers. It was delicious! Fresh bread, quality meat, and large sun dried tomatoes. Only down side is that the tomatoes and bell peppers were drenched in oil, which made my sandwich a bit soggy. Next time, I may ask for it on the side. 
Credit card acceptance, without a minimum charge, is always a plus!!
author: Maria C.

description:
This is my old hood and I still have the pleasure of visiting often.  A lot  has changed and thank goodness some things are still the same "old" here.   If i really want to step back in time, I head into Molinari's where it smells of cured meats, tomato sauce and cheese, it almost sounds the same, except missing is the heavy Sicilian accents. 
This is one of the last handful of REAL Italian  establishments left.  I miss Vanessi's, Panelli Brother's  and all the Italian bakeries that have sadly closed their doors taking their recipes with them.  Thanks for letting me reminisce, I'll get on with it.  

If you want a sandwich, grab a number, head over to the bread box and pick out your bread.  I recommend ordering the specialties, say,  for instance,  the Molinari Combo without any changes.  I tastes best with the works, unless you really hate mustard, but I'm just saying that you might end up loving mustard after eating these sandwiches.  You will not find options for pickled kimchi, arugula, essence of aleppo  oil, aged goat cheese in these sandwiches.  Your options are simple, keep it simple and keep the line moving.  WE MUST KEEP MOLINARI'S ALIVE and SLICING!
author: Chris O.

description:
Team Bourdain here but I'm seriously starting to think his credibility is as good as his nemesis...the guy who looks like he stuck his finger in the wall socket, Guy Fieri.

As a dying breed, I'm all for old skool, mom & pop businesses but a sandwich is only as good as the bread. Just like a pasta dish is only as good as the noodles and pho is only as good as the broth. You get the picture. 

Sorry, but as a native San Franciscan, this place is overrated and overhyped....thanks to Bourdain.

One thing that irked me is that if you order a sandwich, you pick out your roll of choice from a bin. Even though there was one tong, I saw another customer who arrived after me use her hands (no restrooms for customers, no hand sanitizer, no parchment paper available). You know damn well, there be some people who shuffle through the bread bin with their hands looking for the "best" looking roll. Let your imagination run wild here as to where those hands have been. I did...hello, snot pickers and snatch/crotch scratchers! I cringed. I used the tongs to dig out the farthest roll from the top....a sourdough roll.

The owner gentleman was nice (greeted me upon walking in) but the lady who made my sandwich was not. I was obviously a Molinari noob when she instructed me to grab my own bread. I ordered the Renzo Special: proscuitto, coppa (hot or mild), fresh mozzarella, sun-dried tomatoes sandwich ($11.50) and she didn't ask me if I wanted hot or mild coppa--she made my sandwich with mild as default: bit.ly/1jyBzao. I wrongly assumed all sandwiches come with the basic trimmings and spreads. They don't, you have to request it. Of course I didn't know this until I unwrapped my sandwich. So make sure to request every ingredient you want in your sandwich (it's otherwise dry)! 

As I've said, a sandwich is only as good as the bread. The [untoasted] sourdough roll was ridiculously hard, stale, and sharp enough to cut the roof your mouth (this was at 11 am). It was so hard that I couldn't even bite into it. I ended up having to break bread like Jesus, except my disciples were hangry pigeons so I can actually eat the sandwich. Had the bread been fresh and higher quality like Acme or Josey Baker, the sandwich would have been excellent. The fresh mozzarella was deliciously creamy and nicely offset the saltiness of the cured meats. The sun-dried tomatoes added a tangy sweetness, though a bit hard.

Quality meat and cheese for sure but that bread doe. Ugh.

Thankfully, I still have all my teeth...for now.
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
Last genuine italian deli reasonable prices, and delicous food!

I'm in town for work regularly and always try to pick up at least one sandwich from here. My wife's favorite is the meatball, I love trying something new each time. The grab your own bread aspect caught us off guard the first time but it's easy to get used to and definitely helps keep the line moving. Would definitely recommend to try at least once!
author: Enrique E.

description: This place is the real deal. Brought a co worker here for lunch and the sandwiches were great. Place was packed as usual and the service was great.
author: Jon S.

description: really bad coustumer service I dont know de name of the man but he was really unprofessionally.
author: Melvin G.

description: They have a terrific and tasty selection of cured meat salami and pasta along with spices and ingredients to create an Italian culinary art. And the best part is a friendly service even to a stranger. I'm quite sure I want to say that this place is perfect.
author: Ella C.

description: We went in here because from the street it smelled amazing. Yelp said it was good and the prices were decent compared to everything around it. Long line but great service. Smells amazing inside and the food was absolutely fantastic. I will definitely go again. We got the meatball sandwich and the Luciano special. Idk about the Luciano because I didn't eat it, but it was the best meatball sub I've ever had
author: Erica H.

description: Famous for their artisan salami, cured meats, variety of cheeses and pastas, made-to-order delicious sandwiches, and wonderful wine selection.
author: Sabrina P.

description: Gorgeous selection of meats, pasta and other Italian goodies. Can get a little expensive for sandwiches, but quality ain't cheap.
author: Jaylene H.

description: Awesome stop just off of highway 101. So. Many. Meats and Cheeses! Take a number to get service and then Pick your bread of choice. When I asked the man behind the counter what to order for my Dad he said the North Shore sandwich was a great "first-timers" choice. And it was! Everything g here is so fresh and the service was great.
author: Kayla S.

description:
This is the quintessential Italian deli in San Francisco and is one of the most iconic on the West Coast. Molinari has been in North Beach for a long time, and even though most of their meats are now prepared in a different facility, the owners still maintain the look and feel of a classic Italian deli. They are located on Columbus near the heart of North Beach.

On a recent food tour, we stopped here for some sandwiches. With all the meat and cheese options, you can quickly get overwhelmed. We had a special sandwich with soppressata, marinated red peppers, fresh mozzarella, and basil spread; it was very delicious and a good place to start. If you do not have a favorite already, browse the reviews for some good suggestions. Otherwise, you can just grab some ingredients and become your own chef at home or the park.

You can find Molinari salumi all over Northern California, but there is always something special about heading to the source for a real treat. This is just like a classic Italian deli still thriving in the middle of San Francisco. Even with all the ramen, Thai, or gourmet burgers clogging the City, there are still great classic options for everyone.
author: Kristian D.

description:
One of those spots I'm glad our good friend Anthony Bourdain introduced me to. While in town, we ordered pick up through Yelp, menu was very clear, check out was simple. Took less than 5 minutes to pick up from the store even though it was a busy holiday weekend; though, honestly, I wouldn't have minded hanging out a bit longer with the handsome staff!

We got the regular Italian combo and the Renzo, which comes with prosciutto, mozzarella, sun-dried tomatoes, and you can order it as hot as you can handle. The store also has quite the selection of domestic and imported cheeses, and wine. Basically a one-stop shop for all your picnic needs. Now only if it came with one of those handsome Italian gentlemen...
author: Yvette T.

description: It was a good Italian sandwich. Hands down has the best flavor in the meet and the cheese was extra creamy. The whole store just feels Italian and all sorts of meats and cheeses to pick from. The employee did mess up my order but she right awAy re made it. The only thing I didn't like was that they didn't use gloves to make my sandwich
author: Roxanne R.

description: Great Italian deli in SF!! You pick your own bread and everything. So fresh, so delicious.  Incredible.
author: Madison A.

description:
Out of almost 1000 reviews to this day (984) only 8 people complain that workers do not wear gloves while making  sandwiches and then handle cash/credit cards. Those reviews were ranging from one to five stars. The man who was helping me had gloves on but handle cash with the same gloves  and continued to wash hands with the gloves on. When I asked him to change the gloves the just took them off, washed his bare hands but continued to make sandwich with bare hands like all other workers. The "no gloves" sandwich shops is the biggest deal breaker. The other thing  is that you are expected to pick your bread from the container yourself and the other people may have already touched it.
 I choose to be person number nine to mention "no gloves" , because I really enjoyed sampling two of them: grilled focaccia and Molinari special.  
The sandwiches are really delicious and I want to come back some day without putting myself at risk of getting sick. Please wear gloves: subway sandwich people have gloves on or at least get cashier to handle the money.  Raise the price if you need to.!
author: Ally M.

description: Outstanding Italian sandwich! Grab a number, hand over your bread, and get a delicious stuffed delight back in return. I had the Joe's Special - vegetarian sandwich with fresh mozz, sun dried tomatoes, roasted red peppers that rival my mother's (don't tell), and pesto. Even better enjoyed in the sunny park nearby!
author: Samantha K.

description:
I don't really know if stores with Italian names they have and Italian name just because they wanna look cool or wanna attract more customers! But they should know that when a real proper Italian that understands about food walks in and has food is gonna be so f....  disappointed because they ll serve you the most bullshit  merda panino.

The bread has nothing to do with real good Italian bread.

They shouldn't say they make Italian food when there is no Italians serving you and the panini are a complete flop 

You guys can feed only Americans because they don't know shit about food
author: Vittorio C.

description:
So I guess you could say cured meats make me happy... and after taking 1 bite of the Molinari Italian combo, my very long Wednesday got exponentially better. WOW. SO GOOD. Layers of ham, salami, and other various meats... it's an Italian party in your mouth. I wish the bread was a little softer, but hey nothing's perfect. The sandwich was incredibly dense, and I probably should have stopped eating once I'd had half.... but like I said. Cured meats. Happy.

Bada bom, bada bang, this places feels very authentic. So many cheeses and wines... I can't wait to come back. We called our order ahead just in case (went around 12pm), and the line didn't seem too long. 

For $10 you get a massive meal and a nice excuse to walk a little further for lunch!
author: Steph D.

description:
Yes, I know that processed meats cause cancer. Yes, I know that the focaccia carb-y goodness goes straight to the thighs. But Molinari's is so good that I don't care!

This deli is an EXPERIENCE: you walk in and see all the salamis hanging from the ceiling, European goods lining the walls, the employees yelling at each other in Italian ... it truly is a one of a kind place. The number-picking system works out really well for the lunch rush; there ALWAYS will be a queue, so you'll definitely have time to pick what you want. But I must reiterate the many wise Yelpers who have come before me - you have to get the Luciano special! I didn't give in to the hype until after I've been here a couple times and I was awestruck when I finally gave it a try. Definitely up there on the list of best sandwiches I've had. If deli meats isn't quite your thing, there's an adequate amount of vegetarian options on the menu, so this place really is for everyone.

Molinari's is the full package: awesome atmosphere, attentive service, and drool-worthy food. It's a North Beach gem that's always great to visit, whether you're a tourist looking looking for some filling noms or a hangry fella trying to treat yo'self on your lunch break.
author: Desiree S.

description:
Old school italian deli on Columbus. Take a number and choose your bread while you wait to order. 

Pastrami sandwich - 2/5 - Average pastrami. Many better options in the city. 
Luciano special - 4/5 - Great sandwich. Filled with prosciutto and coppa, offset by sun dried tomatoes and mozzarella.  Grilled panini style on a tasty foccacia round. Oils from the tomatoes gave this just the right out of juicyness. 

Overall, good deli with friendly servers. Stick to the specials and pay extra for the foccacia.  "A-OK."
author: Mark O.

description:
It's sad that an establishment, though bouts Italian pride, and is in a neighborhood competitive of delicatessens and Italian bakeries can let it's standards sway.
I've been once before and it was pretty good.  I returned recently and requested a Salami Sandwich.  The sandwich was at best unimpressive and looked thrown together.  Sliced cheese was stacked as if was picked up in a pile and thrown on top in one clump.  The meat, less the I remember.   Worst of all, the roll.  It was so hard I could even chew it.  Stale chisel hard.  After a couple attempts I finally just dumped the bread and ate the innards.   I just should have took it back it after the first bite and got a refund.
author: John W.

description:
Incredible. Sandwiches here are delicious. 

Perfect spot to get an Italian-style sandwich. Great variety of options, bread, meats, Mediterranean food. 

Little pricey but worth paying a premium.
author: Kieran B.

description:
Molinari has been making cured meats since 1896.

They must be doing something right. 

Another San Francisco institution located in North Beach that must be experienced for that old-world charm and one-on-one customer service. It can get busy here in an instant and ordering could seem overwhelming. 

Here's what you need to do:

-Grab a number
-Grab a bread from the bin (if they don't have the type of bread you want, just ask for it when they call your number
-Pick your sammich from their menu or make your own

They have all kinds of salames from dry, hot, Italian, Toscano, Finocchiona, Sopresata, Calabrese, Rosette and Peperoni. They also have Pancetta, Coppa, Mortadella, Galantina, Cotto, Zampino, Beef Tongue and Head Cheese. The quality here is top-notch and the taste is clean. You can really taste the difference and it's not too salty compared to other cured meats that are store-bought. 

As for me, gotta have me some Beef Tongue and Head Cheese. If you're squeamish, just ask the guys working the counter to give you some samples. Don't be afraid to try what some may consider "exotic meats" while these same meats are considered normal in other cultures. 

The place is very intimate so don't get intimidated. They also have all kinds of sausages and they make their sausages the old fashion way. 

This was also featured on Anthony Bourdain's 'The Layover' when he was on the Travel Network. 

Oh and don't let the old guy speaking Italian fool you. He's really Russian, but he's got plenty of character and charm just like this place.
author: John G.

description: amazing ((fresh))mozzarella!! Even as a vegetarian, the mozzarella with sun-dried tomatoes, pesto, and red peppers was amazing! My partner (who eats meat) loved the meatball sandwich and was enamored with the meticulous presentation of the meatball.
author: Gabriella A.

description:
I live in the neighborhood, so I avoid Molinari at all costs on the weekend because every tourist comes here. Unfortunately, though, I don't work in the city so the only time I can go here is on the weekends. 

Their menu is hit or miss. I tend to stay away from their hot sandwiches because they either turn soggy, or the ingredients slide out. 

Don't forget to grab a ticket and your bun as you wait in line.
author: Liz Y.

description: This is hands down one of my (if not, my absolute) favorite delis in the world!! I would make the drive from San Jose just to share their sandwiches and meats with my friends and family!
author: Camille R.

description:
Are you a Goodfella?!?

Yeah, I'm talking to you!

I'm talking to YOU!

This deli seems like something out of a movie. You go in and either you're in the know, or you're not.

I was NOT in the know.

Therefore, I didn't know I was supposed to get a number AND get my own bread.

I was circling around like a fish out of water.

Once I got the drill down I ordered their famous Italian sandwich.

You hand them your bread and they split it open and make your sandwich.

Simple. Fresh. Filling.

It's not Ike's Place, or some chic bakery sandwich, or a Jersey sub place, so if you're a tourist looking for that you've come to the wrong place.

So forget about it!

BUT, if you want an honest to goodness sandwich, come here.
author: Jack R.

description:
This place was packed at lunchtime! And I found out why after eating lunch there...
Order at counter and pay. Yes take cards
A few tables on sidewalk
I was missing NY Arthur Avenue fresh Italian goods and this hit the spot!
Great fresh breads and deli making sandwiches just the way you want! Yummy! Also Italian grocery items
author: Kathy M.

description: Great food, fantastic classic SF vibe, old school service. Shout out to Bobby - best server!
author: Elizabeth S.

description: We always stop here! Everything is always delicious! I grab some pasta and fresh deli meats, bread and cheese! You can't get a better selection just anywhere.
author: Anna H.

description:
Oh how I crave these delicious bites once more, I also admire the authenticity from these sandwiches. So good and I was surprised. Featured on food network. One bite and I just melted. Very flavorful and added peppercini for some spice. 

I wish I knew about this place sooner. Sat outside with the dog and witnessed a tour guide taking their tourists here and describing it as "nirvana." Pretty damn close description. 

If you love deli sandwiches or any sandwiches, come here and give it a shot. They also have their speciality sandwiches along with the option of building your own.
author: Jackie O.

description:
Excellent little sandwich shop and deli.  The freshly baked bread is worth every carb and the veggies and meats are of fabulous quality.  The convenience of having this deli and sandwich shop on sunny Washington Square Park picnic days is awesome.  

I wish there was a more modern and efficient way to order online.  We tried to order sandwiches via Eat24 and they didn't process.  Apparently Eat24 calls Molinari and places the order via phone.  When the deli is busy, the phone is not answered. We had to wait pretty long because we had to go back into the queue
author: Andrea H.

description:
If you're a first-timer, it will definitely be obvious here. 

I wasn't aware that you had to get a number when entering and I wouldn't have known that you had to pick out your own bread had my GF not told me. The first time we went in (yes, we went more than once in three days), it was very busy and I could barely walk around. The service was a bit rushed and the guy that helped went a little too fast while making my sandwich - I didn't even realize he put in half the stuff he did. Either way, the sandwich was amazing! I am a huge sandwich person and it takes a lot for me to be wowed but man, this was great. We ended up coming back the next day (Monday morning) and it wasn't nearly as crowded. I finally got to see that the staff is actually very friendly and helpful. Next time I'm in SF, I will definitely be returning.

We got two sandwiches, roughly $10 each.
author: Ana A.

description:
Definitely one of my favorite sandwiches joints in SF! This place is located kind of in the border line of Chinatown and Little Italy, and it did take me a while to locate the first time I went there.

It's one of those traditional Italian Delis. There are quite a few in SF so for that part of it I guess it was not that unique. Grabbing a number from the machine thing next to the entrance is still the first thing you should do once you walk in.

This place does have quite a few choices of sandwiches. Before they call your number, make sure you go grab (literally) a bread (there are white, wheat, dutch crunch etc) and bring it to the staff going to work on your sandwich. The bread basket will be located right behind you when you face the fridge/counter direction.

Renzo Special: A-.
This sandwich consists of prosciutto, coppa, mozzarella, and sun dried tomato. It's very simple so each ingredient plays an important role - I tried this sandwich two times and quality has been consistently good. 

Great services from the staff. I'm so down to try other sandwiches on the menu next time I go there!
author: Simon C.

description: Awesome authentic Italian deli! You pick the roll they do the rest! Has a large menu of Italian sandwiches and different breads to choose from (hard to soft). The staff is friendly and very knowledgeable about the food they stock. They even hand make their meatballs which are giant and delicious. If you need anything for an Italian dish you plan on preparing this guys have the goods to deliver! So far this was one of the best hidden sand which shops in SF!
author: Johnny D.

description:
Love love love...been comin here since I was a kid. 

 Its still like stepping back in time to old Sf/ little Italy with food they are proud to serve with love. ;-)
author: Lilimonje M.

description: Absolutely love this place!!! Stopped in the city while on a Princess Cruise and just had to buy some of their salami. We make it a point to visit this place, buy a couple of their delicious sandwiches and purchase six sticks of salami weighing 3 pounds each. Fortunately the cruise line had no objection on us bringing it onboard. Only problem this time was the construction on Columbus. I sure hope it does not hurt their business as they have been at this location since 1962 and would hate to have them close and/or move. If you want the best salami ever you must purchase from Molinari!!
author: Pam M.

description:
This place makes the best sandwiches in the whole wide world!  Don't bother with any of the lesser sandwiches - just get the Lombardi Special.  It is the best sandwich there and you will not have to go through the indignity of selecting your bread from "the box".

I have eaten about 25 Lombardi Special sandwiches over the years.  (No, not all at once!)  Get your sandwich and make a bee-line for Rogue Ales Public House.  Eat your sandwich outside on a street table and enjoy a brew... or go to the back garden and eat at the picnic table.  Life does not get a whole lot better than a Lombardi Special and a glass of ale.  See if I'm not right.
author: Steve S.

description: I picked up meat ravioli from this shop. It is very well priced and the quality is very good. It's like 48 small sized fresh ravioli for around 8-9 bucks! They have other options of ravioli as well, but this one seems to be their best seller and it really tastes good.
author: Ash M.

description:
Where else do you get amazing Italian deli sandwiches but in North Beach. Molinari's, a back-to-basics Italian deli and sandwich shop complete with hanging salamis, walls of pasta and various italian sweets and goodies.

First take a number. If you are getting sandwiches make sure you walk over to the sandwich bin on the left side of the store and pick out your bread of choice and hand it off when your number is called.
 
These are the sandwiches good for lunch or dinner and for the price these are huge and really filling:

Renzo Special ~paper thin slices of prosciutto, coppa, fresh mozzarella, and sun dried tomatoes between your choice of bread is so simple, but amazingly delicious. Not too much meat, the perfect creamy mozzarella, and just a hint of chewy sun dried tomatoes is utter perfection. Though, this sandwich does have a horrible habit of getting stuck in your teeth.

Luciano Special ~ OMG! Hands down the best sandwich at Molinari's. The parma prosciutto is among the best in flavor and texture (lit-uh-ly melts in your mouth) with sweet coppa, fresh mozarella, onions, lettuce. The second best part of this sandwich are the whole sun dried tomatoes that are just bursting with flavor. With each bite you get a party of flavors that were all made to go with crunchy, buttery, fresh focaccia bread.
